directions: Get a medium small pot and a wisk
Pre-cut up the stick of butter
add and mix the dry ingredients
pour in the milk
turn on the heat to meadium
mix until there isnt any powder floating on top
add the cut up butter
keep mixing until there isnt any butter chunks left
add vanilla extract
wait until sauce is cool then enjoy :D
cookersNotes: Any milk works, but the more cream in the milk the better (not buttermilk)
Change the amount of vanilla extract added based on the quality
Really easy to store in a quart mason jar - fits perfect

directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees farenheight (175 degrees celcius)

Beat butter, white sugar, and brown sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth. Beat in eggs, one at a time, then stir in vanilla. Dissolve baking soda in hot water. Add to batter along with salt. Stir in flour, chocolate chips, and walnuts.
Drop spoonfuls of dough 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are nicely browned, about 10 minutes. Cool on the baking sheets briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
cookersNotes: The water added must be hot

directions: In a bowl, combine chicken with all of the ingredients for the chicken marinade; let marinate for 10 minutes to an hour (or overnight if time allows).

Heat oil in a large skillet or pot over medium-high heat. When sizzling, add chicken pieces in batches of two or three, making sure not to crowd the pan. Fry until browned for only 3 minutes on each side. Set aside and keep warm. (You will finish cooking the chicken in the sauce.)
Melt the butter in the same pan. Fry the onions until soft (about 3 minutes) while scraping up any browned bits stuck on the bottom of the pan.
Add garlic and ginger and saut√© for 1 minute until fragrant, then add garam masala, cumin, turmeric and coriander. Fry for about 20 seconds until fragrant, while stirring occasionally.
Pour in the tomato puree, chili powders and salt. Let simmer for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally until sauce thickens and becomes a deep brown red colour.

Stir the cream and sugar through the sauce. Add the chicken and its juices back into the pan and cook for an additional 8-10 minutes until chicken is cooked through and the sauce is thick and bubbling.
Pour in the water to thin out the sauce, if needed.
cookersNotes: Garnish with cilantro or coriander and serve with hot garlic butter rice and fresh homemade Naan bread or sticky rice.

directions: Pre-heat oven to 325F
Mix all dry ingredients for the crust
Melt (microwave) and add butter to the drys
Press half of crust into an 8x8 inch glass pan
Slice rhubarb into around 1 cm long pieces and sprinkle into pan
Mix filling and cook it until thickened and clear
Pour the filling on the rhubarb
Sprinkle remaining crumbs on the top
Bake for 1 hour
cookersNotes: Really good with vanilla ice cream
Reduce sugar in the filling or increase rhubarb for more tart-ness

directions: Mix dry ingredients.
Mix water and milk.
Combine remaining ingredients
Mix until no powder left
Cover and let rest
cookersNotes: Water needs to be hot
Use whole milk

directions: Make the day before!
Mix everything but the butter and eggs
Let it sit overnight
When ready to eat, add butter and eggs
For cooking:
Heat up a small pan until it will make water sizzle when sprayed
Put a 1/4th cup of the crepe batter onto the pan
When that side is browned, flip
Done (:
Store extra in mason jars in the fridge for later meals
cookersNotes: Make in large batches and quickly make them in the morning for breakfasts (very fast)
You can put strawberries, syrup, rhubarb, powdered sugar, and a lot more on them (don't eat them plain)

directions: Mix the sauce in a bowl.
Melt butter or oil in a pan on medium-high heat.
Put in almonds and sesame seeds until the sesame seeds start popping. Take them out and put them in a bowl.
Place the salmon in the pan skin-down for 2 minutes
Flip and let it sear for another 2 minutes
Pour the sauce on the salmon and wait for 1 minute
Flip and wait for 1 minute
Take the salmon off and tent it with tin-foil
Reduce the sauce left in the pan until caramelized
Put the saut√©ed almond slices and sesame seeds in the sauce then pour 3/4 of it on the salmon
Serve with some cilantro and avocado garnish along with limes and the left over sauce to put on individually.
cookersNotes: Really good the next day, make more of the almonds and sauce if you like it.

directions: Brown the meat in high heat
Clarify veggies in butter on low heat
Start adding everything while stirring frequently.
Boil for 45 minutes while taste testing to adjust seasoning
Serve on hamburger buns and chips
cookersNotes: The ground beef should be lean
Adding carrot is optional
You can also eat with cheese and pickles.
Very sloppy (:

directions: Crust:
Cut lard and butter into the flour along with salt
Beat eggs, vinegar and water and then drizzle into flour mixture
Make 20 balls of dough at around 110 grams each
Let cool while making filling
Filing:
Chop everything besides Uncle Mike's spices, the meat, and potatoes and clarify with a dollop of butter.
Chop potatoes into small chunks and add into the clarified mix along with the meat and spices
Combining:
Roll out dough into circles while doing this
Add about 170 grams of the filling and wrap the dough circle around it into a sort of bulging half circle.
Cut slits in the top
Put on a pan with the rest and bake for 1 hour at 350F
cookersNotes: If you want them to look pretty, do an egg or cream wash on the pastie before cooking.

directions: Mix dry ingredients in a food processor (don't over-mix)
Add butter and lard to dry ingredients (don't over-mix)
Slowly add the liquids mixture until it balls up (don't over-mix)
Wrap dough in parchment and place in fridge
Once cold, roll out dough and out in pie-pan. Put tin-foil over it and pennies inside to hold the dough down.
Bake at 350F for 20 minutes
cookersNotes: Make sure butter, lard, and water are all cold when used
Don't over-mix
Do more than one and store in a freezer

directions: Make a pie crust (go to independent recipe)
Put everything but the cream cheese in a blender and mix very well.
Put in cream cheese and blend well again.
Pour into crust
Bake at 350F for 15 minutes
Let it sit for 15 minutes then refrigerate
Eat once it is colder
cookersNotes: Cream cheese is put in later to let eggs mix better
Very good with a bit of vanilla ice cream
For this, pastry crust is better than gram cracker crust

directions: Mix dry ingredients in a food processor (don't over-mix)
Add butter and lard to dry ingredients (don't over-mix)
Slowly add the liquids mixture until it balls up (don't over-mix)
Wrap dough in parchment and place in fridge
Once cold, roll out dough and out in pie-pan. Put tin-foil over it and pennies inside to hold the dough down.
Bake at 350F for 20 minutes
cookersNotes: Make sure butter, lard, and water are all cold when used
Don't over-mix
Do more than one and store in a freezer
